clinical_study.brief_title: Measuring Sedation in the Intensive Care Unit Using Wireless Accelerometers
clinical_study.official_title: Measuring Sedation in the Intensive Care Unit Using Wireless Accelerometers

brief_summary.textblock: Maintenance of analgesia during a patient stay in the hospital has been an important area of investigation after demonstrating a direct correlation between level of sedation and mortality in the ICU setting. This study will investigate the use of accelerometers in determining patient sedation level.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of the study is to use accelerometers to track patient movement while under sedation in the ICU. Analysis of patient movement may reveal objective means to measuring patient level of sedation. Average length of stay is estimated to be one week.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of ICU stay: estimated to be one week
primary_outcome.description: Movement during stay in the ICU.

arm_group.description: A wrist and chest accelerometer will be worn for the duration of stay in the ICU. Data will be generated from patient movement and recorded. Neither the generated data or the worn devices will influence care team's decisions during the patients' stay.

study_pop.textblock: Patients receiving care from the neuro ICU at the University of Minnesota will be eligible for participation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admitted to the neuro ICU at University of Minnesota
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to wear accelerometer device
